page.title: 15The Village Hall Bodenham
page.content: The Village Hall is north-east of the A417 about a mile from the centre of the village.Managed by the Parish Hall Management Committee, it was built 11 years ago in 1974. There is a good car park at the side and a field. Every organisation in the village uses the hall at some time during the year. A lot of clubs meet there regularly - like the guides, badminton, table tennis and gardening club.The play group,run by Janet Price, is held on Mondays and Wednesdays. There is also a toddlers group which is held on Thursdays, and baby clinic. In November, bonfire night is usually held on the field and part of an intervillage eisteddfod in the hall. Inside the hall there is a kitchen with a hatch into the hall, ladies and gentlemens toilets, a stage, three committee rooms and a large main hall.
